title: 112_hr6040
content: The Act is titled the "Continued Free Association with Palau Act of 2012" and amends Title I of Public Law 99-658 by adding a section for the 15th-anniversary review agreement. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010, in connection with the Compact of Free Association, are approved, with the exception of the extension of Article X regarding Federal Programs and Services. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010, in connection with the Compact of Free Association are approved. Funding provisions include infrastructure maintenance and a fiscal consolidation fund. The United States will provide funding for infrastructure projects under the Agreement in fiscal years 2012 through 2017. Congress consents to amendments to the Compact subsidiary agreements. The Agreement includes funding for infrastructure projects from 2012 to 2017. Congress consents to amendments to related agreements, with authorization of appropriations for postal services until 2024. The Department of the Interior can transfer funds to the United States Postal Service for mail to Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands. Appropriations to Federal entities under the Compact of Free Association can continue through fiscal year 2024. Appropriations to Federal entities under the Compact of Free Association can continue through fiscal year 2024, with funds remaining available until expended. Section 236 of the Compact applies to commitments of the United States under specific sections of the Compact Review Agreement, with oversight and reporting to appropriate Congressional authorities. The Government of Palau is eligible for certain US domestic programs. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report to specific Congressional committees by March 1 each year regarding financial assistance under the Compact. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report to specific Congressional committees on the use and effectiveness of financial assistance provided to Palau under US domestic programs. The Secretary must consult with the relevant Federal agencies in preparing each report. SEC. 3. OFFSETS. Repeal of prior authorization for civil administration of Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands and limitation on use of funds for global health programs under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The text chunk states that funds for global health activities cannot be used to assist China from 2012 to 2024, with a reduction of $2,000,000 annually. This restriction applies regardless of any other laws enacted. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include Climate Change Funds in Chapter 4 of part II. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include Climate Change Funds in Chapter 4 of part II with a limitation on the use of funds specified in Section 535. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include Climate Change Funds in Chapter 4 of part II with a limitation on the use of funds for assisting the People's Republic of China for climate change activities. The total amount that may be obligated for climate change activities is reduced by $4,500,000 for each fiscal year. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. Additionally, there is a prohibition on funding for Development Innovation Ventures. Prohibition on funding for Development Innovation Ventures program under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961, limiting funds for fiscal years 2012 and 2013 to the United States Agency for International Development. Total amount available for the Agency reduced by $28,200,000. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to limit funds for fiscal years 2012 and beyond from being used to provide assistance to Argentina under the IMET program. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to limit funds for providing assistance to Argentina under the IMET program by reducing the total amount available for such activities for a fiscal year. This subsection applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. Additionally, Chapter 3 of part I of the Act is amended to include provisions related to UNESCO. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to limit funds for providing assistance to Argentina under the IMET program by reducing the total amount available for such activities for a fiscal year. This subsection applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. Additionally, Chapter 3 of part I of the Act is amended to include provisions related to UNESCO. SEC. 308. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS. The text chunk limits funds for US contributions to UNESCO from 2012 to 2024, reducing the total amount by $4,500,000 per fiscal year, regardless of any other laws enacted. The United States Institute of Peace's funds are limited from 2012 to 2024, reducing the total amount by $6,811,000 per fiscal year, regardless of any other laws enacted. The United States Institute of Peace's funds are limited from 2012 to 2024, reducing the total amount by $6,811,000 per fiscal year, notwithstanding any other provision of law enacted after the enactment of this subsection.
